channel.title: Free web hosting and more!
channel.description:
do you need free/cheap web hosting? free SMTP access? great deals on other hosting packages? i found this great site called Log1c web hosting that has some pretty good deals and offers all of the above! they have a great free plan too with tons of features, its the best ive seen yet Check out their packages below or visit their website([url=http://www.log1chosting.com]www.log1chosting.com[/url])
[b]Free Package![/b] Cost: 100% free! Setup fee: Free No banners or ads cPanel control panel 50 MB disk space 3GB bandwidth 1 addon domain 1 parked domain POP3/SMTP access 3 e-mail accounts Webmail access 1 FTP account 5 subdomains PHP enabled Perl enabled CGI access MySQL PostgreSQL 5 SQL databases Custom error pages PHPMyAdmin ...and much more!
[b]Value Package[/b] Cost: $5.00/month Setup fee: Free No banners or ads cPanel control panel 100 MB disk space 5GB bandwidth 5 addon domains 5 parked domains POP3/SMTP access 25 e-mail accounts Webmail access Frontpage Ext.'s 5 FTP accounts 25 subdomains PHP enabled Perl enabled CGI access MySQL PostgreSQL 10 SQL databases Custom error pages PHPMyAdmin ...and much more!
[b]Advanced Package[/b] Cost: $10.00/month Setup fee: Free No banners or ads cPanel control panel 200MB disk space 7GB bandwidth 20 addon domains 20 parked domains POP3/SMTP access 100 e-mail accounts Webmail access Frontpage Ext.'s 20 FTP accounts 50 subdomains PHP enabled Perl enabled CGI access MySQL PostgreSQL 20 SQL databases Custom error pages PHPMyAdmin ...and much more!
They have more packages too it's cool! Their website is [url=http://www.log1chosting.com]www.log1chosting.com[/url] I recommend this webhost. I'm hosting there for free lol if you know any other cool webhosts let me know I might be starting a free/cheap web hosting directory website but this ones the best i've seen so far =)

item.title: Free web hosting and more!
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“mvp566, post:7, topic:20679”]for free this one is great for if ur gunna pay use this site


-If You Buy This You Get Rs2armor Free Hosting.[/quote]

Mvp566, you do know that there is no way possible that they are able to provide you with 40GB space and 900 GB bandwidth. Just think about it, as said on the website, it says they host more than 40,000 websites. They would need a large quantity of servers and would have to be updating them daily. The owners of that site would need to spend big time money on their servers. Honestly, I doubt they host more than 2,000 websites. The plan is just to attract people to buy the hosting because they think it is a really good deal.

SiteGround may cancel any of its services, if SiteGround determines in good faith that this service has become impractical or unfeasible for any technical, legal, regulatory or other reason, by giving Customer as much prior notice as reasonably practicable. SiteGround may also cancel any of its services immediately with no prior notice and with no refund, if SiteGround determines in good faith that Customer's use of the service violates the terms of use.

Customer’s account monthly traffic is limited in accordance with the customer’s hosting plan. If the monthly traffic limit is reached before the end of the month the customer’s account will be suspended until the beginning of the next month. Additional traffic can be ordered for the given month, so that account suspension is avoided. No traffic can be transferred from month to month.

Customer’s account disk space is limited in accordance with the customer’s hosting plan. The maximum allowed space for shared Linux Hosting is 40,000 MB. The following disc space limitations for different file types are also applicable:

  1. NO more than 5,000 MB of a Linux shared hosting account can be allocated to music, video or other multimedia files including but not limited to avi, mp3, mpeg, jpg, gif files.
  2. NO more than 5,000 MB of a Linux shared hosting account can be allocated to any archive files, including but not limited to .rar, .zip, .tar, .gzip files.
  3. NO more than 5,000 MB of a Linux shared hosting account can be allocated to databases dumps including but not limited to .sql files

Look, what do they expect you to do with the other space provided as said in the plan?

Well, just explaining it to guys. I don’t mean to make you unhappy or anything. This site still is a great hosting website especially for forums.

~Leader

Read full topic

@usernamelol wrote:

[quote=“parad0x_, post:10, topic:20679”][quote author=usernamelol link=topic=31390.msg367528#msg367528 date=1162124635]

Log1c Web Hosting does not allow the use by its customers or installation on its servers of any code that could be used for hacking, spamming, DOS or DDOS attacks, attacks on 3rd parties of any kind, crawling of websites to harvest mail or url addresses nor password tracking or spy code of any kind including, but not limited to, publishing for public use any such code whether available for download or just displayed.[/quote]

So? What, you want a host that allows hacking?[/quote]
LOL, was kidding.
